{{third-party|date=November 2018}} [[File:IFSA Network.png|thumb|IFSA Network Logo]]
The '''IFSA Network''' (previously known as the International Finance Students Association<ref name="IFSA Network">{{cite web |title=IFSA Network Website |url=http://ifsa-network.com/ |website=IFSA Network |publisher=WordPress |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref>) is a global [[non-profit organization]] entirely run by students. Its main aim is to give students in the fields of finance, economics, management and engineering, a path to enter the professional world of [[finance]] by providing them with lectures, workshops, competitions and connecting them through a global network.
== History == The IFSA Network was founded in 2014 in [[Rotterdam]],<ref name="IFSA Network: Letter to Stakeholders">{{cite web |title=IFSA Network: Letter to Stakeholders |url=http://ifsa-network.com/letter-to-stakeholders-16/ |website=IFSA Network: Letter to Stakeholders |publisher=WordPress |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref> at the [[Rotterdam School of Management]]. Its first focus was to regroup people studying Finance, and connect them both between themselves and established financial actors. It quickly spread across Europe and Asia, before opening chapters in South Africa and the Americas.
== Concept == The IFSA Network is composed of different chapters throughout the world. The concept is to have semi-independent units,<ref name="IFSA Network: Who Are We">{{cite web |title=IFSA Network: Who Are We |url=http://ifsa-network.com/who-are-we/ |website=IFSA Network: Who Are We |publisher=WordPress |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref> each composed of their own board & active members and to create synergy between these in order to provide the best opportunities to their members. The objective of the association is to build a comprehensive network that connects finance students across the globe and enable them to interact and communicate with each other.
== Hierarchy == Each chapter has a board, composed of a Chairman, Vice-Chairman, Treasure and General Secretary. This board manages day to day operations locally and supervises its regional activities. Chapters also typically have departments (Finance, Marketing, Events), with a department head managing the analysts. Chairmen also regularly connect to establish international strategies and overview national operations.
== Current Chapters == As of 2017, The IFSA Network has the following chapters:
=== Europe === ==== Netherlands ==== Rotterdam School of Management
==== United Kingdom ==== Oxford University
Cambridge University
University College London
London School of Economics
Warwick University
Imperial College, London
==== France ==== Ecole Polytechnique
HEC Paris
ESSEC<ref name="International Finance Student Association: ESSEC">{{cite web |title=IFSA Network: ESSEC |url=http://www.essectransac.com/international-finance-student-association/ |website=International Finance Student Association: ESSEC |publisher=ESSEC |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref>
Ecole Centrale Paris
Supelec University
ENSAE
Sciences Po University
Ecole des Ponts
Ecole des Mines
Dauphine University
Telecom University
ESCP Europe.
==== Switzerland ==== University of Geneva<ref name="IFSA Network: University of Geneva">{{cite web |title=IFSA Network: University of Geneva |url=http://afunige.ch/nos-associations/ |website=AFU |publisher=L’Association Faîtière de l’Université de Genève (AFU) |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref>
University of Sankt-Gallen
==== Italy ==== University of Pavia
Università Commerciale Luigi Bocconi
==== Russia ==== New Economic School<ref name="IFSA Network: New Economic School">{{cite web |title=IFSA Network: New Economic School |url=http://nes-bfsociety.ru/about-us/ |website=NES Suits and Securities |publisher=NES Suits and Securities |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref>
==== Germany ==== Technical University
Ludwig Maximilian University
Goethe University
=== Americas === ==== United States of America ==== Harvard University
Columbia University
==== Brazil ==== Federal University of Rio de Janeiro
=== Africa === ==== South Africa ==== University of Cape Town
=== Asia === ==== Japan ==== Kyoto University
==== China ==== Chinese University of Hong-Kong
==== India ==== Shaheed Sukhdev College of Business Studies
== Events == === Traders' Cup === The IFSA Trader’s Cup is the world’s largest student run trading challenge .<ref name="IFSA Traders' Cup">{{cite web |title=IFSA Traders' Cup |url=http://ifsa-network.com/traderscup/ |website=IFSA Network |publisher=WordPress |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref> All people studying in a recognised university are free to participate. The competition relies on securities trading, and aims to give students an opportunity to distinguish themselves from the competition. The competition is held once per academic year, starting in spring of 2016. For the second edition of the competition, students from more than 35 universities, located in 28 countries on 6 continents competed.
=== Global Case Competition at Harvard === The Global Case Competition at [[Harvard]]<ref name="Global Case Competition Harvard">{{cite web |title=Global Case Competition Harvard |url=http://umcrookston.meritpages.com/achievements/Business-Students-travel-to-2017-Harvard-Global-Case-Competition/71500 |website=University of Minnesota Crookstown |publisher=University of Minnesota Crookstown |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref> is the world’s most prestigious case competition organized by students.<ref name="IFSA Harvard Case Competition">{{cite web |title=IFSA Harvard Case Competition |url=http://harvardcasecompetition.com/ |website=IFSA Harvard Case Competition |publisher=Harvard Case Competition |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref> Its goal is to regroup the best students in finance & economics throughout the world for the length of a few days, in order to test their knowledge and skills and offer them a fantastic opportunity to meet like-minded students, world leading institutions,<ref name="Fredrique Constant">{{cite web |title=Fredrique Constant |url=http://frederiqueconstant.com/blog/frederique-constant-official-timekeeper-of-the-global-case-competition-at-harvard-2017/ |website=Fredrique Constant |publisher=Fredrique Constant |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> and renowned guests.<ref name="Global Case Competition">{{cite web |title=Global Case Competition |url=https://scholar.harvard.edu/nlanter/news/harvard-global-case-competition |website=Harvard University |publisher=President and Fellows of Harvard College |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> The competition is a unique opportunity for participants, connecting the worlds smartest academics<ref name="Global Case Competition"/> from the U.S.A.,<ref name="Business Students Competing in Harvard Global Case Competition">{{cite web |title=Business Students Competing in Harvard Global Case Competition |url=https://article.wn.com/view/2017/02/28/Business_Students_Competing_in_Harvard_Global_Case_Competiti/ |website=WN |publisher=WN |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> Europe, Asia, Latin America and Africa. Taking part in this event is also a great moment in which people can interact with the invited companies , financial institutions, guests and partners.<ref name="Harvard Global Case Competition">{{cite web |title=Business Students travel to 2017 Harvard Global Case Competition |url=https://www.crk.umn.edu/news/business-students-travel-2017-harvard-global-case-competition |website=University of Minnesota Crookston |publisher=University of Minnesota Crookston |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> For the first two editions this event was organized with the Harvard Extension Business Society, an official Harvard Club.<ref name="Harvard Extension Business Society">{{cite web |title=Harvard Extension Business Society |url=http://jay-chakraborty-m964.squarespace.com/ |website=Harvard Extension Business Society |publisher=Harvard Extension Business Society |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> During the first edition, a team from [[HEC Paris]],<ref name="HEC Paris">{{cite web |title=HEC Paris |url=http://campus.hec.fr/the-hec-experience-blog/2017/04/18/team-modigliani-2-0-from-hec-paris-at-the-finals-of-harvard-global-case-competition/ |website=HEC Paris |publisher=HEC Paris |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> a leading French university, won the challenge.<ref name="HEC Paris win Case Competitions">{{cite web |title=HEC Paris wins Global Case Competitions |url=http://www.hec.edu/News-Room/News/HEC-Paris-win-2016-Harvard-International-Finance-Competition |website=HEC Paris |publisher=HEC Paris |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> The second edition was won by the [[London Business School]].<ref name="MiF Students from LBS Win Harvard Global Case Competition">{{cite web |title=MiF Students from LBS Win Harvard Global Case Competition |url=http://www.oneyearmba.co.in/mif-students-lbs-win-harvard-global-case-competition/ |website=ONE YEAR MBA |publisher=ONE YEAR MBA |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref>
=== Local Venues === The various IFSA Network chapters try to offer their communities various local events to connect with the professional world.<ref name="Geneva Students">{{cite web |title=Geneva students are hungry and getting prepared to face the challenges ! |url=https://www.notzstucki.com/ifsa-event-geneva-students-are-hungry-and-getting-prepared-to-face-the-challenges/ |website=NOTZ STUCKI |publisher=NOTZ STUCKI |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> Often, an industry professional will come to the IFSA Network events and meet students. The purpose of those venues is to give students a taste of the professional world, share tips and knowledge, and give an opportunity to network.
=== Boston Consulting Group Case competition === In 2018, the IFSA Network in cooperation with the [[Boston Consulting Group]] and InvestSoc, organised the first, three-week long International Cape Town Case Competition. The competition has a unique format where teams consisting of 2 to 4 participants, propose solutions for crises that are presented to them. In their solutions, participants are able to showcase their knowledge, creativity and problem-solving skills on a current macroeconomic issue. A jury picks the 15 best international teams and the best local teams, from Cape Town. The selected teams arrive in [[Cape Town, South Africa]], to participate in the second round, and present in front of a select panel of distinguished professors and practitioners. The winning team is awarded a cash prize of 5000 South African Rand.
== Network Creation == The IFSA Network is very selective when it comes to opening chapters and selecting board members. Striving for excellency, it will only open chapters in elite universities, and hires only the most ambitious and brightest students. The purpose of this is to ensure smooth operations and maintain a high-level of execution in all of the organisation’s activities. Ultimately, the goal is to have establishments around the world, regrouping all major academic institutions.
== Citations ==
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Business education]]

revision.text:
{{advert|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox non-profit |name = INJAZ Al-Arab |slogan = "Belief in the boundless potential of Arab youth." |location = [https://www.google.jo/maps/place/Injaz+Al+Arab/@31.962726,35.896127,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x9a5486612c1d9d78?sa=X&ei=KqZhVY3nG4rTUavOgdgF&ved=0CG8Q_BIwCg Amman, Jordan] |founded_date = 2004 |area_served = [[MENA]] |homepage = [http://www.injazalarab.org www.injazalarab.org] |image = INJAZALRAB-LOGO-ENG.jpg |image_size = 250px }}
'''INJAZ Al-Arab ''' ([[Arabic]]: إنجاز العرب) is a [[non-profit organization]] for education and training in workforce readiness, [[financial literacy]] and [[entrepreneurship]] across [[the Arab World]]. INJAZ Al-Arab is the Regional Operating Center of JA Worldwide (JAW),<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.jaworldwide.org/ |title=JA Worldwide | date=2015 |website=JA Worldwide |access-date=24 May 2015}}</ref> one of the largest global [[non-governmental organizations]] dedicated to addressing fundamental social and economic challenges facing young people by educating and empowering them to transform their future and own the economic success. INJAZ Al-Arab is also an active participant in the [[United Nations Global Compact|United Nations Global Compact.]] Over 3 million students have participated in a broad base of [[entrepreneurship]] training opportunities aimed at developing basic business skills to start and run their own businesses while obtaining soft skills increasingly demanded by the [[private sector]]. INJAZ Al-Arab has over 45,000 classroom volunteers, who are leaders from the corporate world.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.injazalarab.org/ |title=INJAZ Al-Arab | date=2015 |website=INJAZ Al-Arab |access-date=24 May 2015}}</ref> INJAZ Al-Arab has a Regional Board of Directors, which comprises 22 executives that manage some companies and institutions, as well as a team of staff, led by Akef Aqrabawi, President and CEO of Middle East/North Africa for Junior Achievement Worldwide, INJAZ Al-Arab. <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.injazalarab.org/about/#Staff |title=INJAZ Al-Arab's Staff |website=INJAZ Al-Arab |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.injazalarab.org/about/#BoardofDirectors |title=INJAZ Al-Arab's Board of Directors |website=INJAZ Al-Arab |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://skollworldforum.org/contributor/akef-aqrabawi/ |title=AKEF AQRABAWI, CEO, INJAZ AL-ARAB |website=Skoll World Forum Online |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref>
Other INJAZ branches exist in Qatar,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.injaz-qatar.org/en/content/ashraf-abu-issa|title=Ashraf Abu Issa {{!}} INJAZ Qatar|website=www.injaz-qatar.org|language=en|access-date=2018-06-18}}</ref> Egypt,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.injaz-egypt.org|title=Injaz Egypt|website=www.injaz-egypt.org|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-18}}</ref> Bahrain.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://injazbh.org/|title=INJAZ Bahrain|website=injazbh.org|language=en|access-date=2018-06-18}}</ref>
== History == [[File:Injaz-updated map.pdf|left|thumb|INJAZ Al-Arab's Region Map]] INJAZ Al-Arab began its work in the Middle East & North Africa ([[MENA]]) region in 1999 and joining [[Junior Achievement]], established its regional office in 2004. Since joining JA, and under INJAZ Al-Arab's founder and former CEO Soraya Salti's leadership, INJAZ grew in program availability, student participation, and reach. Today, it operates in 14 countries as a federation of national operations. INJAZ Al-Arab's network includes Algeria, Bahrain, Egypt, Kuwait, Lebanon, Morocco, Oman, Pakistan, Palestine, Qatar<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.injaz-qatar.org/|title=INJAZ Qatar|website=www.injaz-qatar.org|language=en|access-date=2018-06-15}}</ref>, Saudi Arabia, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, and Yemen.
== Activities == INJAZ Al-Arab's programs focus on three core areas of business education which are:
*'''Work Readiness''': The widespread mismatch between the skills attained in school and those demanded by the private sector are feeding current youth unemployment rates. INJAZ Al-Arab programs build teamwork, critical thinking, problem solving, communication, and leadership skills employers look for. *'''Financial Literacy''': Teaching young people about responsible money management is key to building their own financial security and an economically prosperous future for themselves. *'''Entrepreneurship''': Entrepreneurship education prepares youth to be responsible, enterprising individuals. Immersing them in real life learning experiences allows them to take measured risks, manage the results, and learn from the outcomes. This growing number of youth led enterprises creates new jobs and fuels economic development.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.jaworldwide.org/ja-works/Pages/JAs-Core-Content.aspx|title=JA's Core Content|website=JA Worldwide|access-date=27 May 2015}}</ref>
== Sponsors == The Abraaj Group, Bin Zayed Group, [[Gulf Bank of Kuwait|Gulf Bank]], [[Middle East Broadcasting Center|MBC Group]], [[Arab League Educational, Cultural and Scientific Organization|ALECSO]], [[Boeing]], [[HSBC]], [[National Bank of Kuwait|NBK]], [[Alghanim Industries]], [[Citigroup|Citi Foundation]], [[Intel]], [[Schwab Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship]], Amwal, [[J.P. Morgan & Co.]], [[Skoll Foundation]], [[Aramex]], [[Deloitte]], [[The Henry R. Kravis Prize in Nonprofit Leadership|Kravis Prize]], [[The Bank of New York Mellon]], [[ExxonMobil]], [[FedEx]], [[MasterCard]], [[Google]], [[Marriott International]], [[Investcorp]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.injazalarab.org/regional-partners/#RegionalPartners|title=Regional Partners |access-date=26 May 2015}}</ref>
== Knowledge Partners == [[Arab League Educational, Cultural and Scientific Organization|ALECSO]], Bayt, [[Deloitte]], [[DLA Piper]], [[Hill+Knowlton Strategies]], [[McKinsey & Company]], [[Oliver Wyman]], Meysan, [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]], Visual Laundry, [[World Economic Forum]], [[World Bank]], [[YouGov]], [[Engie]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.injazalarab.org/regional-partners/#RegionalPartners|title=Regional Partners |access-date=26 May 2015}}</ref>
== Awards ==
INJAZ Al-Arab and Soraya Salti, former CEO, was awarded [[The Henry R. Kravis Prize in Nonprofit Leadership]] in 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://kravisprize.cmc.edu/prize-recipients/soraya-salti/ |title=Soraya Salti & INJAZ Al-Arab | date=2012 |website=The Kravis Prize in Non-Profit Leadership |access-date=24 May 2015}}</ref>
INJAZ Al-Arab, along with six other organizations throughout the world, was awarded the [[Skoll Foundation]] for Social Entrepreneurship in 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skollfoundation.org/skoll-foundation-adds-seven-organizations-to-its-portfolio-of-leading-social-entrepreneurs/ |title=Skoll Foundation Adds Seven Organizations to its Portfolio of Leading Social Entrepreneurs | date=2009 |website=Skoll Foundation |access-date=26 May 2015}}</ref>
A 2012 study supported by Citi Foundation by professors from Harvard and [[Dubai School of Government]] (now named Mohammed Bin Rashid School of Government''')''' found that INJAZ Al-Arab alumni have a significantly shorter waiting period than other youth while searching for jobs after graduation. <ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.jaworldwide.org/inside-ja/Reports/INJAZ_Al_Arab_Final_Evaluation_Report.pdf|title=Unlocking Arab Youth Entrepreneurship Potential | date=2012 |access-date=24 May 2015}}</ref>
Named one of the top 100 NGOs in the world by [[The Global Journal]] for five consecutive years, INJAZ Al-Arab has influenced the lives of over 2.7 million students since its inception in 2004.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.theglobaljournal.net/article/view/497/ |title=#96 INJAZ Al-Arab | date=2012 |website=The Global Journal |access-date=24 May 2015}}</ref>
== INJAZ Al-Arab in the News == [[Queen Rania of Jordan]] is a supporter of INJAZ Al-Arab. In 2015, she chaired a discussion with entrepreneurs in celebration of INJAZ Al-Arab's 10th anniversary, showcasing alumni's success stories.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2007/11/biz-07women_Queen-Rania_VZPS.html |title=Queen Rania | date=August 2007 |website=Forbes |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.queenrania.jo/media/press/queen-rania-chairs-discussion-entrepreneurs-injaz-al-arab-celebrating-its-10th-anniversa |title=Queen Rania chairs a discussion with entrepreneurs from INJAZ Al-Arab celebrating its 10th anniversary | date=January 2015 |website=Queen Rania Al Abdullah |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://kravisprize.cmc.edu/jordans-queen-leads-event-in-praise-of-injaz-al-arabs-success/ |title=Jordan’s queen leads event in praise of Injaz Al-Arab’s success | date=January 2015 |website=The Kravis Prize in Non-Profit Leadership |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref>
INJAZ Al-Arab is frequent in the [[Skoll Foundation]] website, whose mission is to drive large-scale change by investing in, connecting, and celebrating social entrepreneurs and the innovators who help them solve the world’s most pressing problems.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skollfoundation.org/tag/injaz/ |title=INJAZ AL-ARAB |website=Skoll Foundation |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref>
INJAZ Al-Arab has been mentioned several times in The Skoll World Forum Online, a year-round platform that focuses on a variety of areas, including education and economic opportunity. The Skoll World Forum Online is affiliated with the [[Skoll Foundation]]. Akef Aqrabawi, President and CEO of Middle East/North Africa for Junior Achievement Worldwide. INJAZ Al-Arab has also been featured on the website.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://skollworldforum.org/contributor/akef-aqrabawi/ |title=AKEF AQRABAWI, CEO, INJAZ AL-ARAB |website=Skoll World Forum Online |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://skollworldforum.org/organization/injaz-al-arab/ |title=INJAZ AL-ARAB |website=Skoll World Forum Online |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref>
Soraya Salti, who has also been awarded the Skoll Foundation Award in 2009, has been listed as a social entrepreneur with the [[Schwab Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship]]. According to Schwab, social entrepreneurs drive social innovation and transformation in various fields including education, health, environment and enterprise development.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.schwabfound.org/content/soraya-salti |title=Soraya Salti|website=Schwab Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship |access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Youth organisations based in Jordan]] [[Category:Junior Achievement]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox officeholder | name = Ibrahim bin Abdullah Al Sowayel | office = [[Ambassador of Saudi Arabia to the United States]] | native_name = إبراهيم بن عبد الله السويل | native_name_lang = ar | image = File:AlSowayel.png | caption = Ibrahim bin Abdullah Al Suwaiyel, 1974 | monarch = [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia|Faisal]] | predecessor = [[Abdallah Al-Khayyaal]] | successor = [[Ali Alireza]] | termend = 1975 | termstart = 18 September 1964 | predecessor2 = | monarch1 = [[Saud of Saudi Arabia|Saud]] | office1 = [[Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture (Saudi Arabia)|Minister of Agriculture of Saudi Arabia]] | predecessor1 = [[Abdul Rahman Bin Sulaiman Al-Sheikh]] | successor1 = [[Hassan Al-Mishari]] | termend1 = 29 August 1964 | termstart1 = 31 October 1962 | birth_date = 1916 | birth_place = [[Unaizah]], [[Emirate of Nejd and Hasa]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1977|05|21|1916|df=yes}} | death_place = [[Riyadh]], [[Riyadh Region]], [[Saudi Arabia]] | parents = Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz Al Suwaiyel | allegiance = {{flag|Saudi Arabia}} | branch = [[Saudi Arabian Army]] | rank = [[Major general]] | honorific-prefix = [[His Excellency]] [[Sheikh]] | office3 = 2nd [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Saudi Arabia)|Minister of Foreign Affairs of Saudi Arabia]] | termstart3 = 22 December 1960 | termend3 = 16 March 1962 | monarch3 = [[Saud of Saudi Arabia|Saud]] | predecessor3 = [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia|Faisal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud]] | successor3 = [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia|Faisal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud]] | office4 = [[Ambassador of Saudi Arabia to Iraq]] | termstart4 = 1958 | termend4 = 1960 | monarch4 = [[Saud of Saudi Arabia|Saud]] }}{{Arabic name|Al-Sowayel}}
[[Sheikh]] '''Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz bin Abdullah Al Sowayel''' ({{lang-ar|الشيخ إبراهيم بن عبد الله بن عبد العزيز بن عبد الله السويّل}}; 1916 – 22 January 1977) was a [[Saudi Arabia|Saudi Arabian]] statesman and diplomat who most notably served as the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Saudi Arabia)|Saudi Minister of Foreign Affairs]] from 1960 to 1962. Appointed on 22 December 1960 by [[Saud of Saudi Arabia|King Saud]], he succeeded the future king, [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia|Faisal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud]] and was succeeded by him again in on 16 March 1961. He was noted for being the first non-member of the [[House of Saud|Saudi royal family]] to hold the position of foreign minister. He also served as the Saudi Arabian ambassador to both the United States and Iraq, as the Saudi Minister of Agriculture, and later as a member of the [[Council of Ministers of Saudi Arabia|Council of Ministers]] and an advisor to the Royal Court.
== Early life and education == Al-Sowayel was born in [[Unaizah]], [[Al-Qassim Region|Al-Qassim Province]]. His father was Sheik Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz Al Sowayel, an [[imam]] at a Unaizah [[mosque]]. He graduated from [[Cairo University]], and he was the first [[Najd|Najdi]] person to attend university.
== Career ==
=== Early career === Al Sowayel began his career teaching at a mission school in [[Mecca]], before joining the diplomatic corps of the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Saudi Arabia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://www.kingkhalid.org.sa/Gallery/Text/ViewTextSubjects.aspx?View=Page&BookID=2&PageID=1289&NodeID=28&HitID=58996|title=The death of His Excellency Sheikh Ibrahim Al Sowayel, adviser at the Royal Court|last=|first=|date=21 May 1977|work=Saudi Press Agency|accessdate=|archiveurl=|archivedate=|deadurl=}}</ref> He later served as a political advisor to [[Saud of Saudi Arabia|King Saud]], and a diplomat at the Saudi Embassy in [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]]. From 1958 to 1960, before being appointed foreign minister, he was the [[Ambassador of Saudi Arabia to Iraq]].
=== Minister of Foreign Affairs === Al Sowayel was appointed Minister of Foreign Affairs by a royal decree of King Saud, and took office on 22 December 1960.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mofa.gov.sa/aboutMinistry/MinisterOfForeignAffairs/Pages/NewsArticleID24864.aspx|title=معالي الأستاذ / ابراهيم السويل | المملكة العربية السعودية - وزارة الخارجية|website=www.mofa.gov.sa|language=ar|accessdate=2017-04-27}}</ref> His predecessor was [[Faisal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud]] (later King Faisal), and a close friend. With Faisal having held the office since its creation in 1930, Al Sowayel became the country's second foreign minister, and the first minister not a member of the [[House of Saud|Saudi royal family]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.agsiw.org/royal-reshuffle-saudi-shakeup-consolidates-kings-power/|title=Royal Reshuffle: Saudi Shakeup Consolidates King's Power - Arab Gulf States Institute in Washington|date=2015-04-30|work=Arab Gulf States Institute in Washington|accessdate=2017-04-27|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ipcs.org/print_article-details.php?recNo=4896|title=King Salman: The Boldest Ever Saudi Monarch?|last=Gupta|first=Rajit|date=5 May 2015|website=Institute of Peace and Conflict Studies|archiveurl=|archivedate=|deadurl=|accessdate=26 April 2017}}</ref>
Al Sowayel held the office of foreign minister briefly, for less than two years, before returning it back to Faisal, whom he had asked to succeed him.<ref name=":2" /> He left office on 16 March 1962.
=== Later career === [[File:Ibrahim bin Abdullah Al Suwaiyel and his wife with King Fahd.jpg|thumb|Ibrahim Al Suwaiyel with his wife and [[King Fahd]], 1974]] On 31 October 1962, Al Sowayel took office as the [[Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture (Saudi Arabia)|Saudi Minister of Agriculture]], serving until 29 August 1964.<ref name=":1" /> When [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia|Faisal]] became [[King of Saudi Arabia]], Al Sowayel was appointed [[Ambassador of Saudi Arabia to the United States|Saudi Ambassador to the United States]], serving until [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia#Assassination|Faisal's assassination]] in 1975.<ref name=":1" /> Faisal's half-brother, [[Khalid of Saudi Arabia|Khalid]], became king, and Al Sowayel left his ambassadorship and returned to the capital of [[Riyadh]] to help aide the new monarch. From 1975 until his death in 1977, he served as an advisor to the Saudi Royal Court and as a member of the [[Council of Ministers of Saudi Arabia|Council of Ministers]].<ref name=":1" />
== Death == Al Sowayel died of complications from [[emphysema]] at dawn on 21 May 1977 in Riyadh.<ref name=":1" /> == See also == *[[Embassy of Saudi Arabia in Washington, D.C.]]

[[Image:Bartholomeus van der Helst - Four aldermen of the Kloveniersdoelen in Amsterdam eating oysters.jpg|thumb|260px|right|Reynst (far right), with (from left) his fellow aldermen and contemporaries [[Cornelis Jan Witsen]], [[Roelof Bicker]], and [[Simon van Hoorn]] by [[Bartholomeus van der Helst]] (1655).]]
[[File:Sir William Davidson of Curriehill Abraham Lambertsz van den Tempel.jpg|thumb|260px|Brother-in-law of Johannes Klencke ''Sir William Davidson of Curriehill'', who appointed in 1648 [[Anthonie van Leeuwenhoek]] as his assistant; by [[Abraham van den Tempel]] (1664)]]
'''Johannes Klencke''', '''van Klenck''' or '''Klenckius''' (bapt. 5 March 1620, [[Amsterdam]] - early 1672, [[Batavia, Dutch East Indies]]) was a Dutch teacher in philosophy at the [[Athenaeum Illustre of Amsterdam|Athenaeum Illustre]] in Amsterdam.
==Life== Johannes Klenck was the eldest son<ref>[http://research.frick.org/montias/browserecord.php?-action=browse&-recid=1405 Tullekens, Josias], The Montias Database of 17th Century Dutch Art Inventories, The Frick Collection. Last accessed June 20, 2011</ref> of a trader in Russian [[caviar]] and studied theology in Leiden. On the 24th of May 1644 he accepted a post on issues concerning morality. There he introduced debating with the students. In 1648 he was appointed professor of philosophy at the illustrious school of Amsterdam.<ref>''Humanism in an age of science: the Amsterdam Athenaeum in the golden age'', by Dirk van Miert [https://books.google.com/books?id=WkHMkJOMtWMC&pg=PA68&lpg=PA68 pg. 68]</ref> He taught physics, metaphysics, logic, ethics and politics.
In May 1660, acting on behalf of a consortium of Dutch sugar merchants with plantations in Brazil, he offered the [[Klencke Atlas]] to the King, hoping to gain favourable trade agreements with Britain.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bl.uk/picturing-places/articles/the-klencke-atlas |title=The Klencke Atlas |publisher=British Museum |author=Tom Harper |date= |accessdate=May 13, 2017}}</ref><ref name=barber>Peter Barber. ''The Map Book'', Bloomsbury Publishing USA, 2005. [https://books.google.com/books?id=_tnMJdlgMc4C&pg=PA164 pg. 164]</ref>
In July 1660, [[Louis of Nassau, lord of den Lek and Beverweerd|Louis of Nassau]] arrived in London; his countrymen Simon van Hoorn, curator of the Athenaeum, Michiel van Gogh and the Roman Catholic Joachim Ripperda arrived in November to present to Charles II the [[Dutch Gift]],<ref>''European Treaties Bearing on the History of the United States and Its ...'', [[Frances Gardiner Davenport]], [[Charles O. Paullin]], [https://books.google.com/books?id=mDPF4ILESaUC&pg=RA1-PA73 pg. 73]</ref><ref>[[Pieter J.J. van Thiel|Thiel, P.J.J.]] (1965) Het Nederlandse geschenk aan koning Karel II van Engeland 1660, p. 6.</ref> consisting of furniture, a yacht, 24 paintings, and twelve statues to celebrate the [[Restoration (England)|Restoration]] in 1661?<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B0K8FKZkSr4 Klencke Atlas 1660 - The Beauty of Maps - Episode 3] - BBC Four</ref> The three envoys were assisted by 24 servants and a few clerks <ref>Lammertse, F. & J. van der Veen (2006) Uylenburgh & Zoon. Kunst en commercie van Rembrandt tot Lairesse, p. 65.</ref> when they left [[Brielle|Den Briel]] on 29 October 1660.<ref>Logan, Anne-Marie S. , "The 'Cabinet' of the Brothers Gerard and Jan Reynst" (Amsterdam, 1979), p. 79.</ref> Klencke, an expert on [[Grotius]], may have accompanied them, to discuss 'unrestricted trade', and the [[Act of Navigation]].<ref>Israel, J.I., The Dutch Republic; Its rise, greatness, and fall 1477-1806 (Oxford 1998), p. 749-750.</ref>
He was made a knight on 19 September 1660.{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}}
In 1669 the "nutty professor" (according to [[Isaac Vossius|Vossius]]) left Amsterdam for Paris and London. In 1672 he died suddenly at Batavia as a notary.
==Relatives== Ernst van Klenck, a merchant on Russia, married in 1660 a daughter of [[Pieter de Carpentier]]. In 1661 his brother Herman van Klenck was appointed as a [[Governor of Formosa]], but never set a foot on the island when he noticed [[Fort Zeelandia (Taiwan)|Fort Zeelandia]] was occupied by [[Coxinga]]. Coenraad van Klenck, a trader on Russia and member of the Amsterdam [[vroedschap]], was an envoy to Russia in 1675. Their brother-in-law [[William Davidson of Curriehill]] invited [[Mary, Princess Royal and Princess of Orange|Mary Stuart]] into his house in July 1660 and seems to have been a spy for Charles II. In 1660 he was rewarded with an appointment as conservator of the Staple in [[Veere]].<ref>[http://www.nationalgalleries.org/collection/online_az/4:322/result/0/2261?artistId=190&artistName=Abraham%20Lambertsz%20van%20den%20Tempel&initial=T&submit=1 National Galleries Scotland]</ref>
==Notes== <references/>

{{good article}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox video game | title = Jurassic World Evolution | image = Jurassic World Evolution cover art.jpg | developer = [[Frontier Developments]] | publisher = Frontier Developments | series = ''[[List of Jurassic Park video games|Jurassic Park]]'' | director = Michael Brookes | producer = Craig Abraham | designer = Andrew Fletcher | artist = John Laws | writer = John Zuur Platten | composer = Jeremiah Pena | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]]
[[PlayStation 4]]
[[Xbox One]] | released = 12 June 2018 | genre = [[Business simulation game|Business simulation]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Jurassic World Evolution''''' is a [[Business simulation game|business simulation]] [[video game]] developed and published by [[Frontier Developments]]. Based on the 2015 film ''[[Jurassic World]]'', the game was released on 12 June 2018, for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]]. In the game, players construct a dinosaur park on Las Cinco Muertes [[Archipelago]], a group of five islands also known as the "Five Deaths". The game features more than 40 types of dinosaurs; their [[gene]]s can be modified to introduce new features. Players are given contracts to fulfill by three divisions, Science, Security and Entertainment, allowing them to progress. A sandbox mode set on [[Isla Nublar]], the setting of the film, can be unlocked. The game was created by a development team of approximately 100 people with a budget of around £8 million. Its development began in 2016, after [[NBCUniversal]] approached Frontier Developments about creating a game to accompany the theatrical release of ''[[Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom]]''. To do this, Frontier staff inspected different dinosaur models and reference materials sent by Universal, watched the ''Jurassic Park'' films, read the novels and fan theories. The team consulted paleontologist [[Jack Horner (paleontologist)|Jack Horner]] when they designed the dinosaurs. [[Jeff Goldblum]], [[Bryce Dallas Howard]] and [[B. D. Wong]] reprised their roles from the ''[[Jurassic Park]]'' film series, voicing remarks to players and contributing to the game's narrative. Announced at [[Gamescom 2017]], the game received a generally mixed critical reception. Critics praised its dinosaur designs and graphics, but the game's contracts, simulation and management gameplay were less well-received. The game's tutorial and learning curve were also criticized. Five weeks after its initial release, the game had sold one million copies through digital and physical sales. The game was supported with free updates and [[downloadable content]] upon release. ==Gameplay== [[File:Jurassic World Evolution gameplay screenshot.jpg|thumb|left|A gameplay screenshot featuring the hybrid dinosaur ''[[Indominus rex]]'' from ''[[Jurassic World]]''. To keep dinosaurs happy, players must fulfill different requirements as indicated by the status bar shown at the left.]] ''Jurassic World Evolution'' is a [[business simulation game]] that allows the player to construct a Jurassic World dinosaur theme park with attractions and research facilities. Players must build an Expedition Center, which sends paleontologists to fossil dig sites to obtain dinosaurs' DNA material. [[DNA sequencing]] unlocks new dinosaurs and updates their statistics, such as lifespan and resilience. With enough DNA content, players can use the Hammond Research Center to breed and incubate dinosaurs. Players can also improve the dinosaurs' genes by integrating DNA from modern species with that of the dinosaurs to fill their gaps and allow them to evolve. Modifications to the dinosaurs' DNA change their base statistics, as well as everything from their level of aggressiveness to their appearance.{{cite web|url=https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-03-29-jurassic-world-evolution-finds-a-way-to-be-refreshingly-different|title=Jurassic World Evolution finds a way to be refreshingly different|first=Johnny|last=Chiodini|work=[[Eurogamer]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181024054143/https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-03-29-jurassic-world-evolution-finds-a-way-to-be-refreshingly-different|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The game features a terrain tool which allows players to modify the environment by planting trees and creating water sources. Dinosaurs are the game's main attraction and income earner. The game features approximately 40 dinosaur species at launch.{{cite web|last=Jones|first=Ali|title=Jurassic World Evolution has 40 dinosaur species, including Indominus Rex|url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs|website=[[PCGamesN]]|accessdate=1 April 2018|date=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180614191615/https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players can name each dinosaur after they are incubated.{{cite web|url=https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-06-14-jurassic-world-evolution-review-a-beautiful-overly-brutal-park-sim|title=Jurassic World Evolution review - a beautiful, overly brutal park sim|first=Vikki|last=Blake|work=[[Eurogamer]]|date=14 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916093022/https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-06-14-jurassic-world-evolution-review-a-beautiful-overly-brutal-park-sim|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players need to build enclosures to contain dinosaurs for visitors' viewing. The needs of different dinosaurs, like the type of food they eat and the extent of the social interactions they require, must be met to keep them healthy and satisfied.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamesradar.com/jurassic-world-evolution-build-your-own-park-farm-custom-dinosaurs-pull-out-the-tranq-gun-when-it-all-goes-wrong/|title=Jurassic World Evolution: Build your own park, farm custom dinosaurs, pull out the tranq gun when it all goes wrong|first=David|last=Houghton |date=2 April 2018|accessdate=2 April 2018|work=[[GamesRadar]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612140830/https://www.gamesradar.com/jurassic-world-evolution-build-your-own-park-farm-custom-dinosaurs-pull-out-the-tranq-gun-when-it-all-goes-wrong/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Dinosaurs, controlled by [[artificial intelligence]], will interact with each other and the environment. For instance, carnivores will attack carnivores of a different species, and they will hunt down herbivores. Players also need to construct various entertainment rides, as well as amenities like restaurants and shops to please the guests. An example of tourist attractions is the Gyrosphere or the monorail from ''Jurassic World''.{{cite web|url=https://www.redbull.com/gb-en/jurassic-world-evolution-guide|title=How to build your own dinosaur park in Jurassic World Evolution|first=Ian|last=Dransfield|work=[[Red Bull]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612140202/https://www.redbull.com/gb-en/jurassic-world-evolution-guide|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players can also use the game's photo mode to take pictures of dinosaurs, which help the park to earn money and publicity.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-is-a-chaotic-sandbox-for-/1100-6457769/|title=Jurassic World Evolution Is A Chaotic Sandbox For Dinosaur Management Mayhem|first=Michael|last=Rougeau|work=[[GameSpot]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612143710/https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-is-a-chaotic-sandbox-for-/1100-6457769/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Each entertainment facility and amenity comes with its own management system. Players are able to set and adjust entry fees as well as the number of staff present in each facility. Dinosaurs can be sold to earn additional income.{{cite web|url=https://www.usgamer.net/articles/06-07-2018-jurassic-world-evolution-guide-beginners-tips-and-tricks-create-dinosaurs-divisions/jurassic-world-evolution-sell-dinosaurs|title=How to Sell Dinosaurs in Jurassic World Evolution|first=Jake|last=Green|work=[[USgamer]]|date=7 June 2018|accessdate=8 July 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180708133353/https://www.usgamer.net/articles/06-07-2018-jurassic-world-evolution-guide-beginners-tips-and-tricks-create-dinosaurs-divisions/jurassic-world-evolution-sell-dinosaurs|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Various emergency situations may happen in the park, including power failures, unpredictable weather, and dinosaur breakouts, which must be addressed by players to ensure guests' safety and happiness. Players can build an ACU Center and a Ranger Station, which are responsible for maintaining the park's security. They can sedate escaped dinosaurs, medicate sick dinosaurs, resupply dinosaur feeders, transport dinosaurs, fix fences, and more. Players can also control vehicles from a [[third-person perspective]] such as helicopters and [[4x4]] trucks to complete these tasks. Emergency shelters to protect the guests, as well as other security structures like power network redundancies and storm warning centers, can be built. Many of these security facilities can be upgraded to strengthen their efficiency when dealing with emergencies. ===Gameplay modes=== In the career mode, the player's goal is to develop five-star parks across the fictional islands of the Las Cinco Muertes [[Archipelago]].{{cite web|last=McWhertor|first=Michael|title=Jurassic World park sim coming from Planet Coaster developer|url=https://www.polygon.com/2017/8/20/16176368/jurassic-world-evolution-sim-frontier-developments-ps4-xbox-one-pc|website=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]|accessdate=22 August 2017|date=20 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181003123003/https://www.polygon.com/2017/8/20/16176368/jurassic-world-evolution-sim-frontier-developments-ps4-xbox-one-pc|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-park-evolution-wants-to-show-you-the-best-dinosaurs-youve-ever-seen|title=Jurassic World Evolution Wants To Show You The Best Dinosaurs You've Ever Seen|first=Lucy|last=O'Brien|work=[[IGN]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612145754/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-park-evolution-wants-to-show-you-the-best-dinosaurs-youve-ever-seen|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} [[Ian Malcolm (Jurassic Park character)|Dr. Ian Malcolm]] assists players throughout the game.{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2018/03/13/jeff-goldblum-returns-for-jurassic-world-evolution.aspx|title=Jeff Goldblum Returns For Jurassic World Evolution|first=Matthew|last=Kato|work=[[Game Informer]]|date=13 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162330/https://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2018/03/13/jeff-goldblum-returns-for-jurassic-world-evolution.aspx|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players will meet other key figures representing the three branches of the park's development: Entertainment, Security, and Science. Each of these characters tries to convince players to develop the park in accordance with their advice.{{cite web|url=https://mashable.com/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-game-hands-on/#cHqygDgUTZq6|title=Jurassic 'World Evolution' is the dino video game of our childhood dreams|first=Jess|last=Joho|work=[[Mashable]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180705233358/https://mashable.com/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-game-hands-on/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} They give players "contracts" to complete which include a series of goals and objectives. These contracts add narrative to the game, as well as provide rewards and reputation in their respective domains.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQAY5iLgUVo|title=Jurassic World Evolution - First Official Gameplay Demo|work=Frontier Developments|date=31 March 2018|accessdate=31 March 2018}} Players are advised to keep a close eye on their reputation within each division. If a player's reputation within a division gets too low, that creates a [[sabotage]] in the player's park that will need to be attended to immediately. For instance, the park's power could be shut down allowing dinosaurs to break out, or a disease could be introduced to infect them.{{cite web|url=https://www.polygon.com/2018/6/11/17446528/jurassic-world-evolution-employees-dennis-nedry|title=Your employees in Jurassic World Evolution can sabotage your facilities|first=Ryan|last=Gillian|work=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=8 July 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181024060828/https://www.polygon.com/2018/6/11/17446528/jurassic-world-evolution-employees-dennis-nedry|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} These divisions all feed into the parks' ratings. The five islands, each with different characteristics and challenges, will gradually unlock with sufficient positive park ratings. [[Isla Nublar]] — the island featured in ''[[Jurassic Park (film)|Jurassic Park]]'', ''[[Jurassic World]]'', and ''[[Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom]]''{{cite web|last=Blain|first=Louise|title=Life finds a way. Jurassic World Evolution might just be the game that the movies deserve|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/life-finds-a-way-jurassic-world-evolution-might-just-be-the-game-that-the-movies-deserve/|website=[[GamesRadar]]|accessdate=22 August 2017|date=21 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162513/https://www.gamesradar.com/life-finds-a-way-jurassic-world-evolution-might-just-be-the-game-that-the-movies-deserve/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} — is the setting for a [[Sandbox game|sandbox]] mode that is separate from the game's career mode. The sandbox mode is unlocked once a four-star park rating is achieved on Isla Matanceros, the starting island.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamerevolution.com/guides/395965-jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-how-to-get-unlimited-money|title=Jurassic World Evolution Sandbox Mode: How to Get Unlimited Money|first=Paul|last=Tamburro|work=[[Game Revolution]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916130418/https://www.gamerevolution.com/guides/395965-jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-how-to-get-unlimited-money|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Once this is accomplished, everything players have unlocked in career mode, such as building upgrades and dinosaurs, will transfer over to the sandbox; anything locked in career mode remains in the sandbox.{{cite news|last1=Krupa|first1=Daniel|last2=Murphy|first2=Gav|title=Jurassic World Evolution: Sandbox Mode Details|url=https://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/21/jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-details-ign-first|accessdate=25 May 2018|work=IGN|date=21 May 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612145923/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/21/jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-details-ign-first|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} In sandbox mode, players have unlimited funds, and they can set the weather and time of day at their parks. Challenge Mode, available in an update after the game's release, involves playing with adjustable levels of difficulty and limited money, in addition to other differences like fees and penalties against players. ==Development and release== [[File:Jurassic World Evolution at E3 2018.jpg|thumb|right|''Jurassic World Evolution'' stand at [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 2018|E3 2018]]]] ''Jurassic World Evolution'' was developed and published by [[Frontier Developments]], and is based on the 2015 film ''Jurassic World''.{{cite web|last=Pereira|first=Chris|title=Jurassic World Evolution Mixes Theme Park Sims With Jurassic Park|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-mixes-theme-park-sims-wit/1100-6452667/|work=[[GameSpot]]|accessdate=23 February 2018|date=21 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612141759/https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-mixes-theme-park-sims-wit/1100-6452667/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} [[NBCUniversal]] had wanted a game to accompany the theatrical release of its 2018 film ''[[Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom]]'' and approached Frontier Developments about creating it two years or so before the film's eventual release. Frontier Developments was also interested in creating a dinosaur game.{{cite web |last=Takahashi |first=Dean |title=How Frontier leveled up movie games with Jurassic World Evolution |url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/06/20/how-frontier-leveled-up-movie-games-with-jurassic-world-evolution/ |work=[[VentureBeat]] |accessdate=20 June 2018 |page=1–2 |date=20 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180620231932/https://venturebeat.com/2018/06/20/how-frontier-leveled-up-movie-games-with-jurassic-world-evolution/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The game was created with a development team of approximately 100 people, on a budget of around [[£]]8 million.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/gaming/features/david-braben-interview-1202846009/|title='Jurassic World: Evolution,' 'Elite' Dev on State of Gaming|first=Arthur|last=Gies|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=14 June 2018|accessdate=30 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180703141716/https://variety.com/2018/gaming/features/david-braben-interview-1202846009/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web|last=Hanson|first=Ben|title=Jurassic World Evolution's Developers Share New Details|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2018/04/01/jurassic-world-evolutions-developers-share-new-details.aspx|work=[[Game Informer]]|accessdate=1 April 2018|date=1 April 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612190851/https://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2018/04/01/jurassic-world-evolutions-developers-share-new-details.aspx|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} It was built using Frontier Developments' Cobra [[game engine]].{{cite web |title=Players Can Now Build Their Own Jurassic World as Jurassic World Evolution Launches Today for PC, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One |url=https://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/319860/Players_Can_Now_Build_Their_Own_Jurassic_World_as_Jurassic_World_Evolution_Launches_Today_for_PC_PlayStation_4_and_Xbox_One.php |work=[[Gamasutra]]|accessdate=14 June 2018 |date=12 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180614172134/https://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/319860/Players_Can_Now_Build_Their_Own_Jurassic_World_as_Jurassic_World_Evolution_Launches_Today_for_PC_PlayStation_4_and_Xbox_One.php|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} [[Universal Pictures]] provided the developers with dinosaur models from [[Jurassic Park|the films]] to allow for a high level of detail, as well as reference materials and audio. To aid in creating the game, the development team closely watched the films and read [[Michael Crichton]]'s novels, ''[[Jurassic Park (novel)|Jurassic Park]]'' and ''[[The Lost World (Crichton novel)|The Lost World]]'', and fan theories. In addition, Universal and the team had discussions about various elements in the game.{{cite news|last=Keyes|first=Rob|title=Jurassic World Evolution: Creative Director Michael Brookes Interview |url=https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-michael-brookes-interview/|accessdate=3 April 2018|work=Screen Rant|date=2 April 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612141838/https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-michael-brookes-interview/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} History from each of the films was added to the game. For example, [[Jeff Goldblum]] reprised his role as Ian Malcolm from the first two ''Jurassic Park'' films. [[Bryce Dallas Howard]] and [[B. D. Wong]] also reprised their roles from ''Jurassic World''.{{cite news|last=Chapman|first=Tom|title=Bryce Dallas Howard and BD Wong Will Also Be in Jurassic World Evolution|url=https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-bryce-dallas-howard-bd-wong/|accessdate=25 April 2018|work=Screen Rant|date=25 April 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180714130253/https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-bryce-dallas-howard-bd-wong/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} ''[[Tyrannosaurus rex]]'' was one of the first dinosaurs the development team began working on. For the ''T. rex'' roars, the game's sound team obtained audio samples from the films and then altered them for originality. The animation team then altered their ''T. rex'' roaring animations to fit the sound effects. To design the dinosaurs the development team primarily referred to the films for consistency, while incorporating some of the latest scientific discoveries to add to their designs. The team also studied birds and other animals to aid in designing the dinosaurs. In addition to their designs, dinosaur behavior was based on a combination of the films and scientific findings.{{cite web|last=Krupa|first=Daniel|title=How Jurassic World Evolution Made Its T. Rex|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/16/how-jurassic-world-evolution-made-its-trex-ign-first|work=[[IGN]]|accessdate=17 May 2018|date=16 May 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180711023618/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/16/how-jurassic-world-evolution-made-its-trex-ign-first|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Paleontologist [[Jack Horner (paleontologist)|Jack Horner]], who served as an advisor on the films, was also consulted for advice on the game's dinosaurs.{{cite web |last=Freeman |first=Will |title=Jurassic World Evolution neatly splices together management games and dinosaurs |url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs-guide |work=[[PCGamesN]]|accessdate=20 June 2018 |date=4 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180620232040/https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs-guide|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} They were given bright and colorful hides based on new dinosaur research. In February 2017, Frontier's CEO [[David Braben]] announced the company was working on a new project based on an existing Hollywood property.{{cite web|url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/frontier-third-game-hollywood-movie|title=Frontier will adapt Hollywood movie with “high worldwide profile” for their third franchise|first=Richard|last=Scott-James|work=[[PCGamesN]]|date=6 February 2017|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916094936/https://www.pcgamesn.com/frontier-third-game-hollywood-movie|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} On 20 August 2017, the game was announced during [[Gamescom 2017]].{{cite news|last1=Sliva|first1=Marty|title=Gamescom 2017: Jurassic World Evolution Announced|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/08/20/gamescom-2017-jurassic-world-evolution-announced|accessdate=20 August 2017|work=IGN|date=20 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162718/http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/08/20/gamescom-2017-jurassic-world-evolution-announced|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Later, on 7 October, footage showcasing the in-game engine was revealed during the first annual Frontier Expo.{{cite news|last1=Walker|first1=Alex|title=A First Look At Jurassic World Evolution|url=https://www.kotaku.com.au/2017/10/a-first-look-at-jurassic-world-evolution/|accessdate=9 October 2017|work=[[Kotaku]] Australia|date=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180623032759/https://www.kotaku.com.au/2017/10/a-first-look-at-jurassic-world-evolution/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The game was digitally released for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]] on 12 June 2018, coinciding with the theatrical release of ''Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom''. A free game update based on ''Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom'', with six dinosaurs from the film, was released on 22 June 2018.{{cite news|last=Krupa|first=Daniel|title=Maintaining Order in Jurassic World Evolution (Developer Diary)|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/18/maintaining-order-in-jurassic-world-evolution-developer-diary-a-ign-first|accessdate=25 May 2018|work=[[IGN]]|date=18 May 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162721/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/18/maintaining-order-in-jurassic-world-evolution-developer-diary-a-ign-first|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web |last=Cryer |first=Hirun |title=Jurassic World Evolution Gets Fallen Kingdom-Themed Update, New Dinos and Bug Fixes Included |url=https://www.usgamer.net/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-fallen-kingdom-themed-update-new-dinos-and-bug-fixes-included |work=USgamer |accessdate=22 June 2018 |date=22 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180624064718/https://www.usgamer.net/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-fallen-kingdom-themed-update-new-dinos-and-bug-fixes-included|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Physical copies of the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One version were distributed by [[Sold-Out Software|Sold Out]] on 3 July 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2018-07-19-jurassic-world-evolution-hits-one-million-sales|title=Jurassic World Evolution hits one million sales|work=Gameindustry.biz|date=19 July 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916093353/https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2018-07-19-jurassic-world-evolution-hits-one-million-sales|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web|last=O'Brien|first=Lucy|title=Jurassic World Evolution Gets Official Digital, Physical Release Date: Life finds a way on June 12 and July 3|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-official-digital-physical-release-date|website=IGN|accessdate=1 April 2018|date=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612165151/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-official-digital-physical-release-date|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} In August 2018, Frontier Developments announced an upcoming [[Patch (computing)|patch]] that would alter the sizes of several dinosaurs to match their real-life and film counterparts.{{cite web |last=Capel |first=Chris |title=The Jurassic World Evolution Spinosaurus Will Soon Be Bigger Than The T-Rex |url=https://www.gamerevolution.com/news/419233-the-jurassic-world-evolution-spinosaurus-will-soon-be-bigger-than-the-t-rex |website=GameRevolution |accessdate=19 August 2018 |date=16 August 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180819214248/https://www.gamerevolution.com/news/419233-the-jurassic-world-evolution-spinosaurus-will-soon-be-bigger-than-the-t-rex|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The update was released in September 2018, and included additional sandbox and gameplay options, as well as the addition of Challenge Mode.{{cite web |last=Bankhurst |first=Adam |title=Jurassic World: Evolution Update Adds a Challenge Mode and Changes Dinosaur Sizes |url=https://www.ign.com/articles/2018/09/13/jurassic-world-evolution-update-adds-a-challenge-mode-and-changes-dinosaur-sizes |website=IGN |accessdate=14 September 2018 |date=13 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180914203806/https://www.ign.com/articles/2018/09/13/jurassic-world-evolution-update-adds-a-challenge-mode-and-changes-dinosaur-sizes|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The first paid [[downloadable content]] (DLC), ''Secrets of Dr. Wu'', was released on November 20, 2018. The DLC introduced new story missions, research options and new dinosaur and hybrid species. On the same day, Frontier introduced new AI behaviors and a day-night cycle into the game via a free update.{{cite web|url=https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-11-08-jurassic-world-evolution-gets-secrets-of-dr-wu-paid-dlc-later-this-month|title=Jurassic World Evolution gets Secrets of Dr. Wu paid DLC later this month |first=Matt|last=Wales|work=[[Eurogamer]]|date=November 8, 2018|accessdate=November 10, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Tarason |first=Dominic |title=Jurassic World Evolution mutates with a major update and its first paid DLC |url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2018/11/20/jurassic-world-evolution-update-and-dlc/ |website=Rock, Paper, Shotgun |accessdate=22 November 2018 |date=20 November 2018}} ==Reception== {{video game reviews | MC = (PC) 69/100{{cite web|url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/jurassic-world-evolution|title=Jurassic World Evolution for PC|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180616035903/http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/jurassic-world-evolution|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}
(PS4) 68/100{{cite web|url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-4/jurassic-world-evolution|title=Jurassic World Evolution for PS4|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180922160753/https://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-4/jurassic-world-evolution|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}
(XONE) 76/100{{cite web|url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-one/jurassic-world-evolution|title=Jurassic World Evolution for Xbox One|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724130952/http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-one/jurassic-world-evolution|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} | Destruct = 5.5/10{{cite web|url=https://www.destructoid.com/review-jurassic-world-evolution-508751.phtml|title=Review: Jurassic World Evolution|first=Dan|last=Romer|work=[[Destructoid]]|date=18 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180706074509/https://www.destructoid.com/review-jurassic-world-evolution-508751.phtml|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} | GI = 7/10{{cite web|url=https://www.gameinformer.com/review/jurassic-world-evolution/life-doesnt-always-find-a-way|title=Jurassic World Evolution review: Life Doesn't Always Find A Way|first=Daniel|last=Tack|work=[[Game Informer]]|date=16 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180802011813/https://www.gameinformer.com/review/jurassic-world-evolution/life-doesnt-always-find-a-way|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} | GameRev = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web|url=https://www.gamerevolution.com/review/395445-jurassic-world-evolution-review-holy-fing-st-its-a-dinosaur|title=Jurassic World Evolution Review – Holy F***ing S**t, It’s a Dinosaur|first=Paul|last=Tamburro|work=[[Game Revolution]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181004214405/https://www.gamerevolution.com/review/395445-jurassic-world-evolution-review-holy-fing-st-its-a-dinosaur|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} | GRadar = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web|url=https://www.gamesradar.com/jurassic-world-evolution-review/|title=Jurassic World Evolution Review|first=Sam|last=Loveridge|work=[[GamesRadar+]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180823200916/https://www.gamesradar.com/jurassic-world-evolution-review/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} | GSpot = 7/10{{cite web|url=https://www.gamespot.com/reviews/jurassic-world-evolution-review-life-finds-a-way/1900-6416933/|title=Jurassic World Evolution Review: Life Finds A Way|first=James|last=Swinbanks|date=21 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180624064714/https://www.gamespot.com/reviews/jurassic-world-evolution-review-life-finds-a-way/1900-6416933/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} | IGN = 4.5/10{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/06/11/jurassic-park-evolution-review|title=Jurassic Park Evolution Review|first=Dan|last=Stapleton|work=[[IGN]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180823200915/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/06/11/jurassic-park-evolution-review|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} | PCGUS = 71/100{{cite web|url=https://www.pcgamer.com/jurassic-world-evolution-review/|title=Jurassic World Evolution Review|first=Phillipa|last=Warr|work=[[PC Gamer]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180823200917/https://www.pcgamer.com/jurassic-world-evolution-review/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} }} Critics praised the dinosaurs featured in the game. Sam Loveridge of ''[[GamesRadar+]]'' liked the variety as well as the [[cutscene]] that was displayed when a dinosaur is released from the incubation center. He enjoyed being able to control the jeep and the ACU helicopter from a third-person perspective, a mechanic he applauds for allowing players to relate to the dinosaurs. He added that he "lost entire evenings to [the game] without even thinking" due to its relaxing nature. [[Game Revolution]]{{'}}s Paul Tamburro praised the dinosaurs' design, in particular, Frontier's attention to detail and the dinosaurs' animation. James Swinbanks of ''[[GameSpot]]'' agreed, praising the dinosaurs. He also enjoyed the need to learn each dinosaur's personality, requirements and behaviors, adding the process is "surprisingly satisfying". ''[[Game Informer]]'' {{'}}s Daniel Tack liked that players can experiment with different genes, though he commented that it was not a "freeform experience". Dan Stapleton of ''[[IGN]]'' disagreed and felt that unlocking genes was tedious, describing the process as a series of "mandatory robotic actions". While he liked the dinosaur variety, he lamented the lack of ''[[pterosaurs]]'' and aquatic prehistoric reptiles at launch. ''[[Destructoid]]''{{'}}s Dam Roemer commended the inclusion of lesser- known dinosaurs species, singling out ''[[Giganotosaurus]]'' and ''[[Deinonychus]]''. The simulation aspect of the game received mixed reviews. Loveridge held a positive opinion regarding dinosaur management, as each species has their own needs and niches that players must fulfill. He felt the park management aspect, including the construction of facilities and utilities, was "minimal". Tamburro compared the simulation to ''[[RollerCoaster Tycoon]]'' and ''[[Zoo Tycoon]]''. He enjoyed the chaos created when dinosaurs break out, but he was disappointed that dinosaurs did not attack the park's staff carrying out maintenance inside the enclosures. Philippa Warr of ''[[PC Gamer]]'' praised the dinosaurs but criticized the lack of attention to missions and individual guests' views and happiness ratings on the park. She also noted the simulation lacked depth, as buildings looked largely the same and the environment soon became stale. Swinbanks felt dealing with natural disasters and dinosaur breakout was exciting initially, but soon became repetitive. He also lamented the lack of new challenges presented in the later stage of the game. Tack criticized the tiresome aspect of simulation and the constant need to wait for objectives to be completed, comparing them to a [[mobile game]]. Describing the simulation as "shallow", Roemer criticized the lack of time constraints, cleanliness ratings, and a full day-night cycle. He was also disappointed by the small size of each island, which made park building "unfulfilling". Stapleton agreed, saying that the small islands limited players' creativity. He noted that players cannot speed up time in the game, a signature feature in many other simulators and builders, and criticized its exclusion as it forced players to wait aimlessly to get enough cash to perform an action. The game's contracts garnered mixed opinions. Loveridge believed they helped introduced a structure to the game, though he commented that these missions did not form a cohesive narrative. Tamburro enjoyed the process of progressing from one island to the next, as each island has its own unique layout and landscape prompting players to create a new park that is different from the previous ones. He noted that the contracts helped players to unlock new items, but he felt they were not "exciting". Warr criticized the lack of variety featured in the missions, with different scenarios only presenting minor modifications and adjusting the difficult slightly. He also disliked the contracts for occasionally forcing players to complete missions that do not make sense, such as releasing a dinosaur to kill guests. Swinbanks also criticized three contract factions, adding that players' need to satisfy and balance all three parties demands as "arbitrary". Roemer praised Goldblum's performance, though he noted the overarching plot "goes nowhere". He described the game's progression system as "awful" and wished to skip them entirely. The game's tutorial and guidance to players was criticized. Loveridge noted that certain missions were confusing with some late game objectives being presented too early, forcing him to dismiss them to progress. He singled out the tutorial section for being incompetent, failing to inform players about key aspects of the game such as power distribution and landscaping tools, which often create obstruction. and terrain errors that prevent players from constructing certain buildings and modifying the landscape. Warr noted pacing errors with the tutorials, saying that some of them showed up way too late. Reviewers had mixed opinions of the game as a whole. Loveridge called it an intricate simulation game that fans of the series would enjoy, and he commended the many references to the film featured in the game. Tamburro agreed and called it the best ''Jurassic Park''-themed game, though he noted that the game had more constraints than Frontier's previous park builder, ''[[Planet Coaster]]''. Initially impressed by the game, Warr was disappointed after extended play time feeling the game was lacking depth. Swinbanks noted that despite its shortcomings, the game was "faithful" to the franchise. He felt that it was "a good park management sim in its own right". Roemer felt that the game's development was rushed, and the lack of depth was problematic. Stapleton called it a "bad" game for being largely boring. ===Sales=== Five weeks after its initial release, the game had sold one million copies through digital and physical sales.{{cite web |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/07/19/jurassic-world-evolution-hits-1-million-copies-sold |title=Jurassic World Evolution Hits 1 Million Copies Sold |first=Shabana |last=Arif |work=IGN |date=19 July 2018 |accessdate=19 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180720115530/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/07/19/jurassic-world-evolution-hits-1-million-copies-sold|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} ===Accolades=== The game was nominated for "Best Audio Design" at the 2018 [[Golden Joystick Awards]].{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/gaming/news/golden-joysticks-2018-nominees-announced-voting-open-now/ |title=Golden Joysticks 2018 nominees announced, voting open now |first=Tom |last=Hoggins |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=24 September 2018 |accessdate=18 November 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.gamesradar.com/golden-joystick-awards-2018-winners/ |title=Golden Joystick Awards 2018 winners: God of War wins big but Fortnite gets Victory Royale |first=Connor |last=Sheridan |work=GamesRadar+ |date=16 November 2018 |accessdate=18 November 2018}} {{clear}} ==See also== * ''[[Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis]]'' ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|https://www.jurassicworldevolution.com/}} {{Jurassic Park games}} [[Category:2018 video games]] [[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:Jurassic Park video games]] [[Category:Open world video games]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 games]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 Pro enhanced games]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox One games]] [[Category:Xbox One X enhanced games]] [[Category:Frontier Developments games]] [[Category:Dinosaurs in video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United Kingdom]]

revision.text:
{{primary sources|date=July 2015}} Founded in the United States in 1978, '''Kindermusik''' is an [[early childhood education]] [[music and movement]] program for [[children]] from [[infants]] to 7 years of age (2nd grade in [[Elementary School]]). It is based on a [[Kindergarten]] music and movement program developed by educational experts in Germany in the 1960s. When developing Kindermusik's [[curriculum]], the original creative team drew on the works of esteemed musicians and educators from Europe and Asia, including [[Shinichi Suzuki (violinist)|Shinichi Suzuki]], [[Maria Montessori]], [[Zoltán Kodály]], [[Emile Jaques-Dalcroze]] and [[Carl Orff]].
Within a few years, Kindermusik programs had expanded into Canada, and, from there, around the world. More than 1 million families in at least 60 countries have attended Kindermusik classes in programs worldwide.
The Kindermusik curriculum is based on the research of the original creators, but has been revised as the curriculum development team examines emerging research in child development, music and education. The program uses high-quality recordings, instruments, and award-winning literature books along with traditional nursery rhymes, fingerplays and songs to build a strong foundation of not only music education, but other areas of development, including cognitive, emotional, social, physical, and language development.<ref>http://www.kindermusik.com/about/</ref>
The phrase derives from the German for ''Children's Music''.<ref>https://translate.google.com/#de|en|kindermusik</ref>
[[Kindermusik International]] is a company based in the [[United States]] that develops the curricula and materials used by Licensed Kindermusik Programs around the world.
"[[Kindermusik (Demo)]]" is the name of a five song demo tape independently released by New York City based industrial metal band [[Hanzel und Gretyl]] in 1994.
==See also== *[[Music education for young children]] *[[Baby music]]
==References== <References/>
==External links== *[http://www.kindermusik.com/ Kindermusik]
[[Category:Early childhood education in the United States]] [[Category:Youth organizations established in 1978]] [[Category:Music education organizations]] [[Category:Children's arts organizations]]
